column5: nice looking rods but i havent seen them around yet, if your looking for an ultralight however look into these rods. http://www.basspro.com/Bass-Pro-Shops-Micro-Lite-Graphite-Spinning-Rods/product/10204875/-1645725 i have a 6ft ul and a 7'6 ul both are awsome rods and have caught anywhere from crappies to bows with them while fishing for brookies. great action and feel and for 40 bucks u cant really go wrong, specially with awsome bps warantee!

Tightlines in Pickering carries them as a matter of fact I remember taking them out of the box yesterday. If you don't get there by Saturday though they will be at the Spring fishing and boat show!  Todd

I am interested as well. I am looking for a rod to match up with my recently purchased Pflueger Patriarch. The lightet the better. Just out of curiousity what is the price point of the rapala rod? I am also considering a St. Croix avid.
Lebarons has them, bought the 7ft UL rod last year, and it sure is sweet.... Can't go wrong for the price.
saw it on the lebaron website today, i believe they are on sale right now too!

I was JUST trying now to find these online...cause I couldn't find it elsewhere online for the longest time.  LeBaron has them - but only in LIGHT ACTION....  http://www.lebaron.ca/pdf_files_sp13/rapala_f2_rods.pdf
Three years to get your answer! Thanks for your patience, Kevin.
well there is something else I'm going to be looking for at the sportsman show, when i go this week
PM Sent.  I have a Custom 7' UL that I am considering selling.
rapala rods haven't had the best track record.
Three years to get your answer! Thanks for your patience, Kevin. hehehe. Ultra-Patient indeed.
